columns.name: name
columns.description: The name for the Resolver rule, which you specified when you created the Resolver rule.

columns.name: id
columns.description: The ID that Resolver assigned to the Resolver rule when you created it.

columns.name: arn
columns.description: The ARN (Amazon Resource Name) for the Resolver rule specified by Id.

columns.name: status
columns.description: A code that specifies the current status of the Resolver rule.

columns.name: creator_request_id
columns.description: A unique string that you specified when you created the Resolver rule. CreatorRequestId identifies the request and allows failed requests to be retried without the risk of executing the operation twice.

columns.name: domain_name
columns.description: DNS queries for this domain name are forwarded to the IP addresses that are specified in TargetIps.

columns.name: owner_id
columns.description: When a rule is shared with another AWS account, the account ID of the account that the rule is shared with.

columns.name: resolver_endpoint_id
columns.description: The ID of the endpoint that the rule is associated with.

columns.name: rule_type
columns.description: When you want to forward DNS queries for specified domain name to resolvers on your network, specify FORWARD.When you have a forwarding rule to forward DNS queries for a domain to your network and you want Resolver to process queries for a subdomain of that domain, specify SYSTEM.

columns.name: share_status
columns.description: Indicates whether the rules is shared and, if so, whether the current account is sharing the rule with another account, or another account is sharing the rule with the current account.

columns.name: status_message
columns.description: A detailed description of the status of a Resolver rule.

columns.name: creation_time
columns.description: The date and time that the Resolver rule was created, in Unix time format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).

columns.name: modification_time
columns.description: The date and time that the Resolver rule was last updated, in Unix time format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).

columns.name: resolver_rule_associations
columns.description: The associations that were created between Resolver rules and VPCs using the current AWS account, and that match the specified filters, if any.

columns.name: target_ips
columns.description: An array that contains the IP addresses and ports that an outbound endpoint forwards DNS queries to. Typically, these are the IP addresses of DNS resolvers on your network. Specify IPv4 addresses. IPv6 is not supported.

columns.name: tags_src
columns.description: A list of tags assigned to the Resolver Rule.
